title: T-Money Card
content: Essential for using public transportation like subways and buses! You can easily buy and recharge it at convenience stores. Save on transport costs and travel conveniently.

title: Naver Map & Kakao Map
content: Naver Map and Kakao Map are more accurate than Google Maps in Korea. Useful for real-time public transport info, restaurants, and directions, so install them beforehand!

title: No Tipping Culture
content: In Korea, there is no need to tip at restaurants, cafes, or taxis. Service charges are already included in the price, so you can relax without worrying about tipping.

title: Public Wi-Fi
content: Free Wi-Fi is widely available in subways, trains, cafes, and public places. You can use the internet easily without renting a Wi-Fi device or roaming.

title: Remove Shoes Indoors
content: It's customary to remove your shoes when entering restaurants, accommodations, or private homes. Simply take off your shoes at the entrance.

title: Papago Translator
content: If communicating in Korean is difficult, use the Naver Papago app. It provides accurate translations, including image and voice translation features.

title: Tax Refund
content: Foreign tourists can get a tax refund when purchasing above a certain amount. Receive benefits at airports or designated city refund points.

title: Emergency Numbers
content: In an emergency, call 🚨112 (police) or 🚨119 (fire/ambulance). Emergency requests are handled quickly in Korea.
